explanation: The reported violation is incorrect as stated. OS_API_Teardown contains no string.h calls — it only calls OS_DeleteAllObjects() and OS_ApplicationShutdown(true) — so it cannot directly violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17. The scenario described by agent A actually concerns OS_GetResourceName, which calls OS_strnlen(record->name_entry, buffer_size) followed by memcpy(buffer, record->name_entry, name_len). That code could indeed lead to an out-of-bounds read of the source (record->name_entry) if buffer_size is larger than the actual storage available for record->name_entry or if record->name_entry is not NUL-terminated within its allocation. Whether that is a real MISRA violation depends on whether an invariant guarantees that record->name_entry has at least buffer_size bytes accessible (or is NUL-terminated within buffer_size). No such guarantee is visible in the provided code, so the potential violation exists in OS_GetResourceName, but the original report misattributes it to OS_API_Teardown. Conclusion: the agent A report (that OS_API_Teardown violates Rule 21.17) is not correct.
